RITS.Warning: Be aware, this will clear all Heat/Wanted
RITS.ChooseOneOrTwoEdges: Choose one or two edges and an equal number of flaws
RITS.AddAdditionalTypeOfTeamText:
You can add an additional type to a team or expert by spending two crew upgrades.
When a cohort performs actions for which its types apply, it uses its full quality rating. Otherwise, its quality is zero. A given cohort can have up to two types. Some crew upgrades will add the “Elite” feature to a team, which gives them +1d when they roll for a given Type.
RITS.ClassExpClue1: Every time you roll a desperate action, mark xp in that action's attribute.
RITS.ClassExpClue2: You expressed your beliefs, drives, heritage, or background.
RITS.ClassExpClue3: You struggled with issues from your vice or traumas during the session.
RITS.ClassExpClueDescription: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (in your playbook or an attribute) or 2 xp if that item occurred multiple times.
RITS.CrewExpClue1: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (or instead mark 2xp if that item occurred multiple times).
RITS.TeamTypeTechniciansDescription: Electricians, mechanics, chemists, and software engineers.
RITS.TeamTypeOperativesDescription: Con artists, spies, and social engineers.
RITS.TeamTypeThievesDescription: Lookouts, burglars, pockets, and safe crackers.
RITS.TeamTypeWeirdosDescription: Technicians, wage mages, or techno-cultists (select one or two when you choose this cohort type).
RITS.EdgesFearsomeDescription: The cohort is terrifying in aspect and reputation.
RITS.EdgesIndependentDescription: The cohort can be trusted to make good decisions and act on their own initiative in the absence of direct orders.
RITS.EdgesLoyalDescription: The cohort can’t be bribed or turned against you.
RITS.EdgesTenaciousDescription: The cohort won’t be deterred from a task.
RITS.FlawsPrincipledDescription: The cohort has an ethic or values that it won’t betray.
RITS.FlawsSavageDescription: The cohort is excessively violent and cruel.
RITS.FlawsUnreliableDescription: The cohort isn’t always available, due to other obligations, stupefaction from their vices, etc.
RITS.FlawsWildDescription: The cohort is drunken, debauched, and loud-mouthed.
RITS.HarmImpairedDescription: The cohort operates with reduced quality (-1d).
RITS.HarmBrokenDescription: The cohort can’t do anything until they recover.
RITS.HarmDeadDescription: The cohort is destroyed. You can spend nuyen equal to your Tier +2 to restore it, plus two downtime activities to recruit new team members, or hire a new expert.
RITS.RollTokenDescription: If you want to pull the numbers from a character, select their Token first.
RITS.RollPartialSuccessPositionControlle: You hesitate. Withdraw and try a different approach, or else do it with a minor consequence: a minor complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you suffer lesser harm, you end up in a risky position.
RITS.RollPartialSuccessPositionRisky: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer harm, a complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you end up in a desperate position.
RITS.RollPartialSuccessPosition: You do it, but there’s a consequence: you suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you have reduced effect.
RITS.RollFailurePositionControlled: You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.
RITS.RollFailurePositionRisky: Things go badly. You suffer harm a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.
RITS.RollFailurePositionDesperate: It’s the worst outcome. You suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity for action.
RITS.RollResistance:
You reduce or avoid the effects of the consequence (GM chooses).
Suffer {edge} edge.
RITS.RollResistanceCritical:
You reduce or avoid the effects of the consequence (GM chooses).
Clear 1 edge.
RITS.EffectWarning: Managing Active Effects within an Owned Item is not currently supported by FoundryVTT and will be added in a subsequent update.
RITS.Name: Name
